articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Vietnamese Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Vietnamese Ambassador
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Vietnamese Ambassador to the DPRK Le Quang Ba at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					 After receiving the credentials, Kim had a conversation with the ambassador.

articles.title: Delegation of Elders Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of Elders Leaves
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The elders' delegation headed by Jimmy Carter, ex-president of the United States, left here Thursday by chartered plane.

articles.title: China Reiterates Call for Peaceful Solution to Korean Peninsula Issue
articles.content:
China Reiterates Call for Peaceful Solution to Korean Peninsula Issue
 Beijing, April 26 (KCNA) -- China reiterated its call for dialogues and consultations to ease tensions on the Korean Peninsula, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Hong Lei said at a press conference held in Beijing on April 26, stressing that peaceful approaches are the only effective way to handle the issue. 
					 Hong confirmed that former U.S. President Jimmy Carter and his party stopped in Beijing en route to Pyongyang.
					
					 Foreign Minister Yang Jiechi met with Carter and his party, Hong said, Both sides exchanged views on the issues of mutual concern including the situation of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 China appreciates dialogues initiated by the parties involved, including the United States and the DPRK, Hong said, expressing the hope that these initiatives will eventually result in the resumption of the six-party talks.
					
					 It conforms with the common interests in this region to defend peace and stability in the peninsula, promote denuclearization and realize the normalization of relations of the countries concerned, Hong noted.
					
					 We consider that all parties concerned should settle disputes in a peaceful way through dialogue and negotiations under the present situation and this is the only effective way to handle the issue of the peninsula, Hong said.
					
					 "Concerned parties should use their flexibility, actively interact with each other and resume dialogues and consultations at an early date," Hong said, urging concerned parties to make joint efforts to send the situation on the peninsula "in a good direction".
					
					 China will continue to work with concerned parties and play a constructive role in helping restore peace and stability on the peninsula, Hong said.

articles.title: "Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" Printed
articles.content:
"Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" Printed
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Vol. 8 (enlarged edition) of "Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" was printed in the DPRK.
					The book contains 44 works published by General Secretary Kim Jong Il from January 1977 to March 1979, including speeches, talks and conclusions.
					
					 Among them are "On the Main Tasks Arising in the Party Work at Present", "Work with People Is Basic to Party Work" and "Let Us Increase the Party's Fighting Efficiency and Bring about a Fresh Turn in the Building of Socialism", which set forth important tasks arising in improving the party work as required by the development of the revolution.
					
					 Such works as "On Improving the Agitprop Work in the People's Army" and "Some Problems Arising in the Party Political Work of the People's Army at Present" give perfect answers to questions arising in the party political work of the People's Army.
					
					 They include works that deal with the historical significance of the Pochonbo battle commanded by President Kim Il Sung, the principled problem arising in education in the revolutionary traditions and ways for building the Samjiyon Grand Monument on the highest level.
					
					 Also contained in the book are works that advance tasks for hitting the grandiose goal of socialist economic construction laid down by the Workers' Party of Korea and comprehend the ideas and theories on developing the Juche-based literature and arts of the DPRK onto a new stage.
					
					 Besides, there are works which give comprehensive answers to the theoretical and practical problems arising in socialist construction, including the matters of establishing the revolutionary traits in the implementation of the party policy and meeting the people's demand in construction and the tasks for tightening labor administration discipline and setting up cultured ways in production at industrial establishments.

articles.title: Rice Sowing Makes Headway
articles.content:
Rice Sowing Makes Headway
Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Sowing of rice in seedbeds is going on in rural communities of the DPRK.
					 According to data available, the sowing had been done at more than 75 percent across the country as of April 22.
					
					 This year North Phyongan Province has recorded the sowing 30 percent higher than the same period of last year.
					
					 Sariwon City, Pongsan County and Hwangju County of North Hwanghae Province have sown seedbeds in a scientific and technological way.
					
					 Peasants of Jaeryong and Yonbaek plains in South Hwanghae Province have pushed forward the sowing as planned.
					
					 Such achievements have also been reported from Pyongyang and Nampho Cities, and South Phyongan and South Hamgyong Provinces.
					
					 Rural communities in North Hamgyong and Kangwon Provinces have sown high-yielding rice seeds suitable for their geographical characteristics.

articles.title: Folk Play "Bow Dance"
articles.content:
Folk Play "Bow Dance"
						
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- "Bow Dance" is one of the folk dances associated with the Korean people's spirit of defending the country.
					 According to historical records, Koguryo, an ancient state (B.C. 277-A.D. 668) of Korea, encouraged archery competitions in holidays and appointed winners as military officers.
					
					 Seen in Koguryo tomb murals are archery competition and "Bow Dance".
					
					 When an archer hit the target, music began and the shot danced joyfully, cheered by the crowd. Then some of the spectators joined him in dance.
					
					"Bow Dance" was derived from the spectacle.
					
					 Simple movements and merry and impressive rhythms characterize the dance.
					
					 Some movements of the dance are applied to modern dance pieces.

articles.title: DPRK's Nursing and Upbringing System of Children
articles.content:
DPRK's Nursing and Upbringing System of Children
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Thirty-five years has passed since the Law on the Nursing and Upbringing of Children was adopted in the DPRK.
					 In his lifetime President Kim Il Sung always paid deep concern to the nursing and upbringing of children.
					
					 Though the country was in difficult conditions after the liberation from the Japanese colonial rule, he took measures to build nurseries and kindergartens throughout the country and establish a system of taking care of them at the state expense.
					
					 The system worked well even in the days of the Fatherland Liberation War. More nurseries, kindergartens and schools were built for war orphans during the days.
					
					 With foundations of the self-supporting economy laid and a socialist system established in the country after the war, the President guided the effort for developing the nursing and upbringing system.
					
					 The number of nurseries and kindergartens was raised sharply and their material foundations consolidated. Their teachers also increased numerically.
					
					 Basing himself on the achievement in nursing and bringing up children, the President had the law adopted on April 29, Juche 65 (1976).
					
					 The law grants great benefits to the Korean children.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Establishing System of Party Leadership
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Establishing System of Party Leadership
Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il made public his famous work "On Thoroughly Establishing the System of Party Leadership" on April 28, Juche 68 (1979).
					 He in his work comprehensively clarifies the theoretical and practical issues arising in establishing the system of party leadership, including the matters of letting the revolutionary traits of unconditionally carrying through the party's decisions and instructions to the end prevail in it, making the iron-like discipline reign over it, leading the party members to properly lead a party life with the right conception of a party organization, increasing the militant function and role of party organizations and helping the officials to improve their leadership art.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a signed article:
					
					 The work serves as an important document to be always held fast to in thoroughly establishing the system of party leadership and accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche and a mighty militant banner encouraging the whole army and all the people to effect epoch-making creations and changes.
					
					 The past several decades since the publication of the work have been a significant period during which the system of party leadership has been consolidated to remarkably increase the militant function and role of the party organizations.
					
					 The Korean revolution has reached the historic phase of carrying out the cause of building a thriving nation in all fields. The Conference of the Workers' Party of Korea held last year marked an important occasion in strengthening and developing the party into a permanent party of President Kim Il Sung and augmenting its leading authority in every way. It is the spirit of the party conference to invariably defend the centre for unity and the core of leadership, build a thriving nation, weathering trials and difficulties and accomplish the revolutionary cause true to the great party, no matter how much water may flow under the bridge.
					
					 The article calls on all party organizations and party members to thoroughly embody the ideas and theories enunciated in the work as required by the developing revolution and thus firmly ensure the leading authority of the party and bring about a decisive turn in improving the standard of people's living and building a great prosperous and powerful nation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Economic Crisis in Capitalist Countries
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Economic Crisis in Capitalist Countries 
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The economic crisis in the capitalist countries is by no means a phase of the course of business cycle which had been generally called an economic crisis in the past but an overall economic crisis accompanied by economic chaos and fluctuation deepening in all aspects, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a bylined article.
					 The worst is the financial crisis, it notes, and goes on:
					
					 The present financial crisis is rapidly spreading with the greatest destructive power in the financial history of capitalism.
					
					 The destructive power is shaking the financial ruling system of the capitalist world to its very foundation and bringing about a final collapse of the U.S. dollar-dominated system.
					
					 The overall economic crisis in the capitalist countries is bringing serious consequences to the world economic development and international relations.
					
					 Contradictions and discord are festering between the U.S. and other capitalist countries and between the developed capitalist countries and developing countries as the economic crisis is gaining in depth.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists, now in the grip of the economic crisis, are seeking a way out of it in igniting a war of aggression against the anti-imperialist independent countries and, furthermore, are working hard to unleash a new regional war, a global war. But such act is nothing but bluffing and it will only precipitate their doomsday.
					
					 The serious economic crisis sweeping the capitalist world, acute confrontation among big powers, the struggle of the toiling masses in the capitalist countries for vital rights and freedom and the intensified anti-imperialist struggle of the people of developing countries are the natural consequences entailed by the overall economic crisis in the capitalist countries.
					
					 It is an important way for warding off the baneful impact of the above-said economic crisis to develop a self-supporting national economy, destroy the outdated and unfair international economic order and build instead a new fair one, concludes the article.

articles.title: Minju Joson on Songun Politics
articles.content:
Minju Joson on Songun Politics
Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The Songun politics pursued by General Secretary Kim Jong Il is an all-powerful treasured sword for settling all the issues arising in achieving the cause of national reunification, says Minju Joson Thursday in a bylined article.
					 It is thanks to the Songun politics that the Korean People's Army has grown to be a matchless army capable of wiping out any formidable enemy at one blow, the DPRK has turned into an impregnable fortress and there has emerged a strong driving force for the revolution with the KPA as its core, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, the landmarks common to the nation which were set up on the road of national reunification, would be unthinkable without the Songun politics.
					
					 It serves as a powerful motive force which helps strengthen the driving force for national reunification.
					
					 The KPA and the Korean people are playing a pivotal role in the nationwide movement for national reunification while bringing about world-startling events one after another in the drive to build a thriving nation by displaying the might of the single-minded unity around Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The pro-reunification patriotic forces of south Korea are growing stronger thanks to the great attraction of the Songun politics.
					
					 Many organizations for the reunification movement appeared as it became a trend to study and support the Songun politics which helps defend the dignity of the nation and pave the road for independent reunification. The above-said organizations are waging actions against the U.S. and the conservative group in a mass and organized manner as they have intensified their moves against reunification and for war, pushing the inter-Korean relations to the worst phase.
					
					 The KPA and the Korean people will always advance under the uplifted banner of Songun and thus build a prospering reunified country on this land, concludes the article.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Blocking North-South Working Contact
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Blocking North-South Working Contact 
						
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The Unification Committee of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions has staged a demonstration in Seoul since April 25 denouncing the authorities for blocking the exchange between the workers in the north and the south of Korea.
					 The chairman of the committee, after participating in the first day demonstration, accused the Ministry of Unification of obstructing the south-north working contact slated to take place in Kaesong on April 28 for the co-sponsorship of the event on the May Day.
					
					 He said that the ministry clarified its stand to disallow the event even before accepting the application for contact and took the same attitude even after accepting it.
					
					 Recalling that the ministry obstructed the above-said organization's recent exchange of fax messages with the north, he blasted the present regime for its "policy toward the north."
					
					 He demanded the authorities replace the minister of Unification and drop their policy of confrontation with the DPRK.

articles.title: Former Staff Member of "National Intelligence Service" Declared Guilty
articles.content:
Former Staff Member of "National Intelligence Service" Declared Guilty
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The Seoul Central District Court sentenced a former staff member of the "National Intelligence Service" to a prison term, according to south Korean MBC on April 26. He investigated the wife, relatives and confidants of Lee Myung Bak during the preceding regime.
					 It was reported that he conducted an investigation into their irregularities and corruption on the instruction of the superior at that time.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Accused of Holding Alumni Reunion Meeting
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Accused of Holding Alumni Reunion Meeting
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on April 26 carried an editorial titled "Is the president allowed to hold an alumni reunion meeting with taxes collected from people?"
					 The editorial recalled that Lee Myung Bak invited at least 200 graduates from Tongji Commercial High School in Phohang to Chongwadae on April 9 and held the above-said meeting.
					
					 Present there was Lee Sang Duk, lawmaker from the "Grand National Party" who is an elder brother of Lee Myung Bak, it said.
					
					 At least ten million won might be spent for the meeting, it said, and went on:
					
					 There is no law that allows the "president" to hold such meeting with the taxes collected from the people.
					
					 If this is allowed to happen, no one can say any words critical in case provincial governors, mayors, county headmen and other officials across south Korea hold similar meetings for wining and dining at state expenses.
					
					 To make matters worse, Lee Myung Bak is accused of not distinguishing public affairs from private ones.
					
					 He had better brace himself again as a government official.

articles.title: Repeal of S. Korea-US Alliance for Aggression Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repeal of S. Korea-US Alliance for Aggression Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea on April 25 issued a statement denouncing the authorities for working hard to tighten the military alliance for aggression with the U.S. 
					 The statement recalled that a meeting of vice-ministers of foreign affairs and defense between south Korea and the U.S. would be held in Washington on April 26.
					
					 It noted:
					
					 The purpose of the meeting is to discuss the follow-up measures for implementing what was debated at the talks between the ministers of foreign affairs and defense in July last year and the talks between the ministers of foreign affairs on April 16 this year. It will take up the issues of realizing the "strategic flexibility" of the U.S. forces present in south Korea and boosting cooperation and alliance with the U.S. and military cooperation among south Korea, the U.S. and Japan and other issues.
					
					 The statement accused the U.S. of seeking to further subjugate south Korea in the military and economic fields and the authorities of fully meeting the U.S. brigandish demands.
					
					  It demanded the authorities scrap at once the aggressive and humiliating military alliance with the U.S. at once as it runs counter to independence and peaceful reunification on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Joint Declaration on Situation Published in S. Korea
articles.content:
Joint Declaration on Situation Published in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The Confederation of Trade Unions and the Federation of Trade Unions of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on April 25 and published a joint declaration on the situation denouncing the misrule of the authorities.
					 The organizations deplored in the declaration that the appearance of the present regime brought back the society to the era of dictatorship in the past. 
					
					 They accused the conservative ruling forces of administering state affairs in a self-opinionated manner, cracking down on the people and hamstringing the efforts to achieve democracy. 
					
					 They accused the authorities of having created a touch-and-go situation by pursuing a policy hostile to the fellow countrymen.
					
					 They urged the present regime to put a definite end to administering state affairs in an arrogant, self-righteous and repressive manner and through confrontation with fellow countrymen and apologize before the people.
					
					 If the ruling forces refuse to meet the demand of the workers, they will come out in the actions against the present "government", they warned.

articles.title: GNP Defeated in By-election in S. Korea
articles.content:
GNP Defeated in By-election in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The opposition parties of south Korea beat the "Grand National Party" in the by-election held on April 27.
					 The by-election aimed to fill the vacancies in the posts of lawmakers, provincial governors, district heads and county headmen was a hot contest as it may influence victory or defeat in the general elections next year.
					
					 The Democratic Party defeated the ruling party in the election of lawmaker for Pundang District No.2 of Songnam City, Kyonggi Province in which the GNP claimed never suffered a defeat.
					
					 The DP also beat the candidate from the ruling party in the election of the governor of south Korean Kangwon Province.
					
					 A candidate of the Democratic Labor Party who ran for the election to the "National Assembly" as the only candidate from the opposition camp won the election in Sunchon, South Jolla Province.
					
					 The GNP was defeated by the opposition parties in the election of district heads and county headmen in many other areas.
					
					 The election returns are a stern judgment meted out by the south Korean people to the present conservative ruling forces hell-bent on sycophancy towards the U.S., fascist dictatorship, anti-reunification acts and moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 It is reported that GNP representative An Sang Su and all other leading members resigned after owning the responsibility for the debacle in the election on April 28, creating a great confusion.

articles.title: Korean Pencil Drawing and Fine Art Work Exhibition Held in China
articles.content:
Korean Pencil Drawing and Fine Art Work Exhibition Held in China
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- A Korean pencil drawing and fine art work exhibition was held in China from April 14 to 16 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Displayed at the venue were pencil drawings, Korean paintings and oil paintings showing the Korean people in the efforts to build a thriving nation.
					
					 Speeches were made at its opening ceremony.
					
					 Li Zhaoxing, chairman of the Foreign Affairs Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress and president of the China Association for International Friendly Contact, said that the exhibition would help the Chinese get better understanding of the long history and folk customs of Korea, its scenic landscape and unique style of painting and the achievements made by the Korean people in state building and their indomitable mental power.
					
					 To strengthen cultural exchange between China and the DPRK is of weighty significance in deepening the beautiful friendship between the two peoples, he noted.
					
					 The China Association for International Friendly Contact will make every possible effort to steadily develop the Sino-DPRK friendly relations which were provided and fostered by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries and had withstood the trials of history, he stressed.

articles.title: Brief Biography of Kim Il Sung Aired by Democratic Congo TV
articles.content:
Brief Biography of Kim Il Sung Aired by Democratic Congo TV
						
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- TV of Democratic Congo broadcasted the brief history of President Kim Il Sung's revolutionary activities several times on April 12 and 13.
					 It displayed a photo of Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and photos of the President conducting external activities.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Commemorated Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Commemorated Abroad
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries between April 9 and 17 to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They included seminars, round-table talks, lectures, film shows and Taekwon-Do championships in Russia, Kyrgyzstan, Italy, Netherlands, Bulgaria, Congo, Tanzania and Malaysia.
					
					 Among the Korean films shown were "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "A Broad Bellflower".
					
					 The chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgys El" Republican Political Party of Kyrgyzstan said that Kim Il Sung is a distinguished thinker-theoretician who founded the Juche idea and the great brilliant commander and prominent strategist who defeated the two U.S. and Japanese imperialisms.
					
					 The president of the Group of Dialectical Materialists of Italy noted that Kim Il Sung performed great feats for the country and the people and the human cause of independence.
					
					 We will fully support the Korean people in the efforts to build a great prosperous and powerful socialist country, he said, expressing the will to actively conduct various political and cultural events on the occasion of the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Radiation Getting More Serious in Japan
articles.content:
Radiation Getting More Serious in Japan
						
Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Radiation caused by the accident at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant of Japan still remains a serious problem.
					 The Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan on April 25 published the results of the analysis of the contamination of atmosphere and soil in a place about 4 km northwest of the nuclear power plant.
					
					According to it, iodine-131 of 310 Bq per one cubic meter was detected in the atmosphere in Maeda, Futaba chon and this is more than 62 times the radiation limit in ordinary times at the power plant. Cesium-137 of 380,000 Bq per one kg of earth was detected in Yamata, Futaba chon.
					
					 As high concentration of radioactive substance is still detected in Futaba chon near the power plant, the Jiji Press reported that radioactive substance is believed to have ceaselessly leaked from the power plant.
					
					 The chief Cabinet secretary announced a ban on cultivating rice in the evacuation area within the radius of 20 km centering around the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant. 
					
					 An assistant to the prime minister said that no one predicted that there might occur a hydrogen explosion at reactors of the power plant right after the massive earthquake on March 11, thus officially admitting that there are no countermeasures against the possible hydrogen explosion.
					
					  The rising level of contaminated water and radiation at Reactors Nos. 3 and 4 of the power plant is creating difficulties in the work to tide over the crisis. 
					
					According to NHK, the level of the contaminated water in the pool of Reactor No. 3 rose 2 cm in 23 hours till 6 p.m. on April 25 and that of underground water near the building that houses the turbine rose 10 cm as compared with that before three days. Radioactive substance 1,000 times that of Reactor No. 4 was detected in the underground water near Reactor No. 3.
					
					 The results of measurement of concentration of radioactive materials in the underground water near the building which houses turbine of Reactor No. 4 on April 21 led to confirming that the level of  cesium-134 and 137 and iodine-131 was 250 times and 12 times respectively as compared with that one month ago.
					
					  The level of underground water in Reactor No. 4 is 115 cm as of April 25, 20 cm higher than that ten days ago.
					
					  NHK reported that the failure to solve the problem of contaminated water would make it impossible for the power plant to launch a full-dress work. It said that the Tokyo Electrical Power Co. would face bigger difficulties in the transfer and disposal of contaminated water in the future.
					
					 The Japan National Police Agency announced that the death toll caused by quake and the ensuing tsunami increased to 14 508 as of 10:00 on April 27. 
					
					 Researchers of the Earthquake Institute of Tokyo University analyzed that quakes are likely to occur in those areas influenced by the movement of the earth's crust caused by the massive earthquake as the ground of Tokyo and areas around it is affected by the movement.
					
					  It is reported that the probability that a magnitude of 7 earthquake will jolt Minami-Kanto area in three decades to come is 70 percent at present.

articles.title: Hu Jintao Refers to Tasks of Youth and Students
articles.content:
Hu Jintao Refers to Tasks of Youth and Students
 Beijing, April 26 (KCNA) -- Chinese President Hu Jintao referred to the tasks of youth and students, on April 24 when addressing the meeting marking the 100th birthday of Qinghua University.
					 The building of comprehensively well-off society and the socialist modernization drive provide the young people with stage of worthwhile life, he said. And he called upon the students of Qinghua University and other youths and students across the country to perform honorable feats for the people and the era by real actions with the ambition to contribute to the state and serve the people.
					
					 Science and technology are fundamental, talents core and education basis in promoting a wonderful and rapid development of economic society, he said, underlining the need to strictly implement the party's policy of education to train socialist builders and successors.

articles.title: Chinese Vice-President on Developing Cooperation in Defense and Security
articles.content:
Chinese Vice-President on Developing Cooperation in Defense and Security 
						
 Beijing, April 26 (KCNA) -- Xi Jinping, vice-president of China and vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China, called for steadily developing cooperation in defense and security.
					 This call was made when he spoke to the participants in the meeting of army chiefs of general staff of member nations of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization on April 25.
					
					 Cooperation in defense and security is an important cooperation field of the organization, he said, adding that China attaches high priority to exchange and cooperation in this field within the framework of the organization.
					
					 China will jointly increase the capability to cope with new threat and challenge and thus provide peaceful, safe and stable circumstances for the development of each country and its people's wellbeing, he said.

articles.title: CPLA Chief of General Staff on Development of Relations with Russia
articles.content:
CPLA Chief of General Staff on Development of Relations with Russia
 Beijing, April 26 (KCNA) -- Chen Bingde, chief of the General Staff of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, on April 24 referred to the development of relations with Russia at the talks with his Russian counterpart Nikolai Makarov.
					 The U.S. and the EU hinder the defense building of China but Russia helps China in the field of military technology, Chen said.
					
					 China and Russia are taking unified attitude toward most of international issues, he noted, adding that the consensus of views between the two countries is based on mutual respect and trust.

articles.title: Russian President on Way for Combating Drug Crimes
articles.content:
Russian President on Way for Combating Drug Crimes 
						
 Moscow, April 26 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev recently pointed to the way for combating drug crimes.
					 Smugglers are changing means and methods to introduce drugs into Russia, he said, adding that the units combating drug crimes should be armed with modern technical equipment to fully cope with the crimes.
					
					 He also underscored the need to act strictly on the law.

articles.title: Russian Government to Fully Discharge Its Social Duty
articles.content:
Russian Government to Fully Discharge Its Social Duty
Moscow, April 26 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin, speaking at a recent meeting, declared that his government would fully discharge its social duty for the citizens.
					 The government will not abandon its social duties for the citizens under any condition and circumstance, he said.
					
					 He added that the government registered successes in carrying out the plan for social development despite economic difficulties and budgetary deficit.

articles.title: Myanmar President Calls for Added Momentum in Nation Building
articles.content:
Myanmar President Calls for Added Momentum in Nation Building
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Myanmar President Thein Sein, addressing a meeting on April 22, urged his government to implement nation-building tasks with added momentum so as to catch up with the neighboring nations by tapping human resources and natural resources.
					 He stressed the need to complete the major projects under way within two or three years and produce agricultural items and build a modern industrialized nation.
					
					 He called on the national people to strive for development of the state.

articles.title: Azerbaijan Rejects Military Solution to Iran Nuclear Issue
articles.content:
Azerbaijan Rejects Military Solution to Iran Nuclear Issue
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Azerbaijan will not accept a military solution to the Iranian nuclear issue, said Foreign Minister Elmar Mammadyarov in a newspaper interview published Monday. 
					 "As Iran's immediate neighbor we will certainly not accept a military solution," he stressed.

articles.title: ElBaradei Suggests War Crimes Probe of Bush Team
articles.content:
ElBaradei Suggests War Crimes Probe of Bush Team
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Former chief U.N. nuclear inspector Mohamed ElBaradei suggests in a new memoir that Bush administration officials should face international criminal investigation for the "shame of a needless war" in Iraq.

articles.title: Expression of Neo-Nazism Denounced in Lithuania
articles.content:
Expression of Neo-Nazism Denounced in Lithuania
						
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The Lithuanian Foreign Ministry recently released a statement to criticize the expression of neo-Nazism in some cities of the country.
					 Flags of the fascist regime and slogans against Jews were seen in some cities of Lithuania.
					
					 In this regard, the statement said that it is an act of sowing discord among nations, a provocation to the state and an attack on the civil society.
					
					 Those responsible for such behaviors will be severely punished by law, it stressed.

articles.title: PNA Condemns Israeli Defilement
articles.content:
PNA Condemns Israeli Defilement
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The chief of the media bureau of the Palestinian National Authority (PNA), in his recent interview with a news agency, denounced Israel for insulting Palestinians.
					 The PNA complained to the branch of Subaru in Israel for publishing the commercial photo, which mocks the accident of Israeli settler running over stone-throwing children in east Kuds seven months ago, he said, adding that it is immoral act and a complete disregard of the life of the Palestinians.
					
					 He noted that "it encourages more violence against the Palestinians."
					
					 He called on Israeli authorities to stop publishing this immoral commercial.

articles.title: US Policy toward Russia Slammed
articles.content:
US Policy toward Russia Slammed
						
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The world forum on Russia took place in Washington some days ago.
					 The Russian newspaper Kommersant on April 4 reported that the conflicting views between Russia and the U.S. over the issue of repealing the Jackson-Vanik Act surfaced as a serious problem at the forum, reminding one of the Cold War era.
					
					 This act makes it compulsory to take discriminatory trade steps against Russia as it is a trading act revised and adopted by the U.S. in 1974 in retaliation against the steps of the former Soviet Union to restrict its citizens seeking asylum overseas. The dissolution of the former Soviet Union reduced the act to a dead paper. But the U.S. keeps applying the act against the republics of the former Soviet Union including Russia.
					
					 This affects to a certain extent the positive efforts of those countries to develop economy.
					
					 At the forum the U.S. declared that it would repeal the act when Russia settles its "human rights issue".
					
					 This goes to prove that the act is nothing but a lever for domination and interference to hinder the independent development of those countries.
					
					 After the demise of the Cold War the U.S. prattled that it would help Russia, claiming that it is not the enemy of the U.S.
					
					 Visiting Russia in July 2009, the U.S. president said that the U.S. would boost economic cooperation and investment in Russia.
					
					 But the recent forum once again brought to light that the promise made by the U.S. to Russia is a sheer lie.
					
					 The U.S. administration is seeking to lay a military siege to Russia by expanding NATO and establishing its MD in Europe, etc. and working hard to make an effective use of the act to this end.
					
					 The application of the act is a vivid expression of the U.S. hegemonic policy to contain and weaken Russia, displeased with Russia's growing position in the international arena.
					
					 The U.S. is keen to contain not only Russia but various countries of the world aspiring after independent development by invoking such draconic acts as the above-said act. 
					
					 But the U.S. is seriously mistaken.
					
					 No force on earth can stem the trend of the times toward independence.

articles.title: NATO Soldiers Killed in S. Afghanistan
articles.content:
NATO Soldiers Killed in S. Afghanistan
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The loss of NATO forces is increasing in Afghanistan owing to the attack operation of the resistance forces.
					 Two more NATO soldiers were killed in southern Afghanistan on Saturday bringing to four the number of multination force casualties in a single day.
					
					 More than 130 NATO soldiers have been killed in Afghanistan since beginning this year.

articles.title: Volcano Erupts in Kamchatka, Russia
articles.content:
Volcano Erupts in Kamchatka, Russia
 Moscow, April 26 (KCNA) -- The Shebeluts volcano erupted in Kamchatka, Russia on April 24.
					 Volcano ashes rose as high as up 7,500 meters above the sea level, covering the sky extending 143 km northwest from the crater.

articles.title: Hong Lei insiste en diálogo para resolver el problema coreano
articles.content:
Hong Lei insiste en diálogo para resolver el problema coreano
Beijing, 26 de abril (ATCC) -- En la entrevista de prensa que tuvo lugar el día 26 en esta capital, el portavoz de la cancillería china, Hong Lei, destacó que los contactos pacíficos son el único remedio efectivo para manejar el problema coreano, y continuó:
					El ex presidente norteamericano, Jimmy Carter, y su comitiva hicieron escala en Beijing para su visita a la República Popular Democrática de Corea.
					
					Ellos fueron recibidos por el ministro de RR.EE. Yang Jiechi.
					
					En la ocasión, ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones sobre los asuntos de interés mutuo, tales como la situación de la Península Coreana.
					
					China aprecia diálogos iniciados por las partes involucradas, incluso EE.UU. y la RPDC.
					
					Deseo que esas iniciativas resulten en la reanudación de las conversaciones a 6 partes.
					
					Es el objetivo primario de China salvaguardar la paz y la estabilidad en la Península Coreana y promover el proceso de desnuclearización de esta área y la normalización de relaciones entre los países regionales. Esto conviene a los intereses comunes en esta región.
					
					Consideramos que todos los países interesados deben resolver las disputas en una vía pacífica mediante el diálogo y negociaciones bajo la situación actual y esto es la única manera efectiva para manejar el problema de la península. 
					
					Las partes interesadas deberán usar su flexibilidad, interactuar activamente con cada otra y retomar diálogos y consultas en una fecha cercana.
					
					China seguirá trabajando con las partes interesadas y jugará un rol constructivo para contribuir al restablecimiento de paz y estabilidad en la Península Coreana.

articles.title: ATCC comenta la política de EE.UU. sobre Rusia
articles.content:
ATCC comenta la política de EE.UU. sobre Rusia
Pyongyang, 28 de abril (ATCC) -- Hace poco, tuvo lugar en Washington el foro mundial sobre Rusia.
					De acuerdo con el rotativo ruso Kommersant del día 4, en esa reunión se agravaron las discrepancias entre Rusia y Estados Unidos en torno a la cancelación de la ley Jackson-Vanik haciendo recordar la era de Guerra Fría.
					
					Esta ley comercial fue enmendada y aprobada en 1974 por EE.UU. como contramedida a la decisión de la ex URSS de limitar el exilio de los ciudadanos y aplica obligatoriamente las medidas de discriminación a Rusia en el plano comercial. 
					
					Si bien se hizo injustificable por la desintegración de la URSS, EE.UU. sigue aplicándola contra Rusia y otros países ex soviéticos, lo cual influencia en cierta medida en el desarrollo económico de ellos.
					
					En el foro arriba mencionado, EE.UU. dijo que cancelaría la polémica ley si Rusia resuelve el "problema de DDHH".
					
					Esto comprueba que la ley es un medio de intervención en asuntos internos y dominación para impedir el desarrollo independiente de Rusia y otros países ex soviéticos.
					
					Después de terminada la guerra fría, EE.UU. fingió estar interesado en ayudar a Rusia diciendo que "ésta ya no es su enemigo".
					
					El presidente estadounidense, que visitó en julio de 2009 a Rusia, prometió que su país fortalecería la cooperación económica y las inversiones en Rusia.
					
					Pero, el reciente foro sobre Rusia demostró que son embustes todas las promesas de EE.UU.
					
					La administración norteamericana intenta formar el cerco militar sobre Rusia mediante la ampliación de la OTAN y el establecimiento del sistema de defensa antimisil en Europa y usar eficientemente en este fin la ley Jackson-Vanik.
					
					Esta ley es una expresión coherente de la política dominacionista de EE.UU. de no aceptar el fortalecimiento de la posición de Rusia y de detener y debilitar las influencias de ésta en la arena internacional.
					
					EE.UU. pretende aplicar otras leyes por el estilo de la Jackson-Vanik también a otros países del mundo que luchan firmemente por su desarrollo independiente.
					
					EE.UU. está muy equivocado.
					
					No se puede impedir por nada la corriente de la época hacia la independencia.
